head.citation-title: Two-dimensional quaternion linear canonical series for color images
head.abstracts: © 2021The quaternion-based moments and transforms are among the essential tools for color image processing, and received increasing attention and interest from researchers. In this paper, a novel two-dimensional quaternion linear canonical series (2-D QLCS) for describing color images is introduced. The capabilities of the proposed 2-D QLCS on image representation and reconstruction are analyzed. The proposed 2-D QLCS can be acquired from the common two-dimensional linear canonical transform series (2-D LCTS). The relationships between 2-D QLCS and 2-D LCTS are investigated in detail. Experimental results verify the correctness of the proposed method and show that 2-D QLCS has ideal performance in terms of scale invariance, numerical stabilities and image representation.

grant-text.$: This work is supported by the National Natural Science Foundation of China (No. 62171041) and National Key R&D Program of China (No. 2020YFC2006205).

grant-agency.$: Innovative Research Group Project of the National Natural Science Foundation of China
National Natural Science Foundation of China

copyright.$: Copyright 2021 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

coredata.dc:description: The quaternion-based moments and transforms are among the essential tools for color image processing, and received increasing attention and interest from researchers. In this paper, a novel two-dimensional quaternion linear canonical series (2-D QLCS) for describing color images is introduced. The capabilities of the proposed 2-D QLCS on image representation and reconstruction are analyzed. The proposed 2-D QLCS can be acquired from the common two-dimensional linear canonical transform series (2-D LCTS). The relationships between 2-D QLCS and 2-D LCTS are investigated in detail. Experimental results verify the correctness of the proposed method and show that 2-D QLCS has ideal performance in terms of scale invariance, numerical stabilities and image representation.
coredata.dc:title: Two-dimensional quaternion linear canonical series for color images
